reviews.text:
Pilning station is operated by Great Western Railway and is what is known as a Parliamentary station, with currently 2 trains on a Saturday going eastbound.  The reason for this is that the footbridge was taken down in  2016 as a result of the engineering and electrification works that are taking place in that area

The trains are operated by Great Western railway  

There is a campaign to get the footbridge back and also a better service (see campaign that is referred to on the other reviews)

This is a must to relieve pressure on the Severn Beach Line and also with the industrial units that are near by and I am sure regular services will serve the wider community

There fore there are limited and very basic services at the station with only a help point and a shelter

GWR will not get true numbers if tickets are not collected (when I used it I bought mine in advance and it was never checked!!)  Group proactive in looking into numbers at the station each week

It currently only has one platform and is a fair walk from the "village"
Far too busy for my liking
Because the station is brilliant, it MUST receive a footbridge and a regular service #FootbridgeForPilning
Station full of smiley confident people! Very close to motorway junction too! Recommend you try and come here!

Lovely station, sadly not used much. Had a wonderful victorian bridge to platform 2 which got taken away in September 2016 due to the electrification going through. Meaning no more platform 2. Recommend you go here!
